intro: Cryptantha weberbaueri, commonly known as the Sierra cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and meadows, and is adapted to arid environments. Its seed pods are cylindrical and dehiscent, releasing seeds when mature. Cryptantha weberbaueri is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountain ranges, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
